verses.verse: {Hezekiah's Illness and Recovery} d During that time, {Lit. During those days} Hezekiah became ill and was at the point of death. Then Amoz's son Isaiah the prophet came to him and told him, "This is what the Lord says: «Put your house in order, because you are going to die. You won't recover.»"
Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord.
"Please, Lord ,"he said, "Remember how I have walked before you faithfully and with a true heart, and I have done what pleases you." {Lit. done what is good in your eyes} And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
Then this message {Lit. Then the word} from the Lord came to Isaiah:

"Go tell Hezekiah, «This is what the Lord God of your ancestor David has to say: "I've heard your prayer and {So 1QIsa a LXX; the Heb. lacks and} I've seen your tears; so I will add fifteen years to your life.

I'll save you and this city from the {Lit. the hand of the} king of Assyria, and I'll defend this city, for my own sake and for my servant David's sake. {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack for my own sake and for my servant David's sake}
This is the Lord's sign to you that the Lord will carry out this thing he has promised:

Watch! I will make the shadow on the steps of the upper {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks upper} dial of Ahaz that marks the sun go ten steps backwards."»" Then the sunlight turned back on the dial the ten steps by which it had gone down.
{Hezekiah's Prayer} d A composition by King Hezekiah of Judah, following his illness and recovery:

I said, "Must I leave in the prime of my life? Must I be consigned to the control {Lit. gates ; i. e. the place where legal cases were adjudicated} of Sheol? {I. e. the realm of the afterlife} Bitter are {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read the rest of} my years!"

I said, "I won't see the Lord {Lit. Yah ; So 1QIsa a ; MT reads Yah Yah ; MT mss read Lord} in the land of the living; and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} I'll no longer observe human beings among the denizens of the grave. {Lit. cessation ; or the end ; So 1QIsa a MT; MT mss read the world}

My house has been plucked up and vanishes {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT read and has been taken away} from me like a shepherd's tent; like a weaver, I've taken account of {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads have rolled up} my life, and he cuts me off from the loom day and night you make an end of me.
I've been swept bare {So 1QIsa a ; or I cried for help ; MT reads I was composed ; cf. Targ} until morning; just like a lion, he breaks all my bones day and night you make an end of me.
Like a swallow or a crane I chirp, I moan like a dove. My eyes look weakly upward. O Lord, {So 1QIsa a MT; 1QIsa b reads LORD} I am oppressed, so {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks so} stand up for me!

What can I say, so I tell myself, {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads for he has spoken to me} since he has done this to me? {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and it is he who has done it} I will walk slowly all my years because of my soul's anguish.
"My Lord is against them, yet they live, and among all of them who live is his spirit. {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads is the life of my spirit} Now you have restored me to health, so let me live!

Yes, it was for my own good that I suffered extreme anguish. {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT read bitter, bitter} But in love you have held back {So 1QIsa a ; cf. LXX; MT reads you have loved} my life from the Pit {I. e. the realm of punishment in the afterlife} in which it has been confined; {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads pit of destruction} you have tossed all my sins behind your back.

For Sheol {I. e. the realm of the afterlife} cannot thank you, death cannot {So 1QIsa a LXX; implied in 1QIsa b MT} sing your praise; and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} those who go down to the Pit {I. e. the realm of punishment in the afterlife} cannot hope for your faithfulness.
The living yes the living they thank you, just as I am doing today; fathers will tell their children about your faithfulness.

The Lord will save me, {At this point a later scribe inserted into 1QIsa a a repetition of v. 19 and the beginning of v. 20, but with some different spellings and a word missing.} and we will play my music on strings all the days of our lives in the Lord's Temple. {The same second scribe continued with the rest of this verse; not originally in 1QIsa a .}
Now Isaiah had said, "Let them prepare {So MT; LXX reads Take ; 1QIsa a lacks Let them prepare} a poultice of figs and apply it to the boil, so that he may recover."
Hezekiah also had asked, "What will be the sign for me to go up to the Lord's Temple?" {38:21-22 So 1QIsa b MT LXX; 1QIsa a lacks vs. 21-22; a later, third scribe, includes vs. 21-22}
